entry.title: Rico Sasaki (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Rico Sasaki (pictured) beat 9,000 other auditioners to play the title role in a Japanese production of Annie in 2008?

entry.title: concert in Hawaii (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Beach Boys played a concert in Hawaii while high on LSD?

entry.title: Laura Tàunâjik (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that with as many as a quarter of mothers in eastern Greenland experiencing domestic violence, Laura Tàunâjik proposed a women's shelter in Tasiilaq?

entry.title: Ge rum i Bröllopsgåln din hund! (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Bellman's song "Ge rum i Bröllopsgåln din hund!" describes "one of the wildest weddings in Swedish literature"?

entry.title: Dermot Morrah (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Dermot Morrah, a British journalist for The Times, wrote Princess Elizabeth's 21st birthday speech?

entry.title: front-of-package labeling system (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that an investigation found that most Mexican nutrition science students could not interpret a nutritional front-of-package labeling system correctly?

entry.title: Samuel Kneeland (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in 1752, Samuel Kneeland and his partner produced the first Bible in the English language ever printed in America?

entry.title: it's pronounced "gif", not "gif" (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that it's pronounced "gif", not "gif"?
